definitions.definition: to see something or someone for a very short time or only partly:
examples: We glimpsed the ruined abbey from the windows of the train.

definitions.definition: an occasion when you see something or someone for a very short time:
examples: I only caught (= had) a fleeting glimpse of the driver of the getaway car, but I know I would recognize her if I saw her again.

definitions.definition: a quick idea or understanding of what something is like:
examples: This biography offers a few glimpses of his life before he became famous.
